alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Northern Ware; Pierce; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Pierce, north central Echols, southwestern Brantley, central Ware, central Clinch and northwestern Charlton Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Fort Mudge to 12 miles southeast of Manor to 10 miles north of Needmore. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Nahunta, Boggy Bay, Manor, Braganza, Raybon, Fort Mudge and Needham. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Northern Ware; Pierce; Western Charlton
